description:
Of all the Philz in the city this one is by far my favorite. 

First off its huge, so there is ample seating area. Although sometimes it can be packed with college students, it is still more spacious then the rest of the Philz in the city.

Second off, they move quickly, they seem to have a longer coffee bar and more stuff---SO LESS WAIT TIME.

Finally, there is usually parking nearby, if you can't find street parking there is a whole foods next door with a parking lot so you can also get some groceries , two birds with one stone (or parking spot in this case)!
author: Joanna M.

description:
3.5 stars. 

Coffee is pretty reliable as most Philz goes, a fantastic abundance of outlets and a decent amount of seating. Good location with good food selections nearby, and parking is not too bad with Whole Foods across the street and a fair amount of 2 hr street parking. Baristas

The bathroom is the main reason I just can't give an excellent review... Horrid. Literally always reeks of urine (probably because the toilet doesn't have any water in it at baseline, but really God knows why). Paper towels and toilet paper everywhere..... frequently out of toilet seat covers. 

Whyyyyyy Philz!?!? You are a coffee shop. As coffee connoisseurs, you are aware that naturally, coffee = frequent trips to the bathroom. Restroom maintenance is essential.
author: M J.

description:
Love my Philz Coffee. Every time I come here I always get an awesome cup of coffee . The service is always great and make sure that I sip and completely satisfied. I love the environment and it's very easy to work here with having WiFi access. I try to always go to locations I haven't been into just to try out the different food. I do miss Philz's on Virgin America flights. 

Note: my favorites are always Estatic, Mint Mohito and Philz's Ice Tea.
author: Etienne L.

description:
I love my classic Iced Mint Mojito!

Refreshing and caffeinated with plenty of sweetness! 

There's strong black coffee as well, but I can never turn down their mint mojito!  My first experience of their signature drink was down at Berry street in Soma!  Ever since then, it has expanded by many! 

Spacious seatings, but many occupied seats!

Cool place to grab and maybe chill if one wants to chat over coffee!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This was my second visit to a Philz Coffee - I actually requested that my friend take me here so I can have another Iced Mint Mojito. It's so good!! 

They make all their drinks on the spot, so you're always getting fresh coffee. The baristas were really nice and friendly. Cashiers were also very friendly and nice. 

We ordered breakfast - I had their breakfast sandwich, BF had a chocolate croissant, and our friend had a scone. Everything was tasty and filled us up before our drive down to Monterey.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Philz Coffee and their mint mojitos can always get me through the day. This particular Philz is pretty big and there's plenty of space to sit and do work or chat with friends. 

So as mentioned, I always get their mint mojito even though I pretend to think I'll try something different. It's hard not to get mint mojito whenever you're at Philz, the next best thing is to probably buy a bag of Philz coffee for home use. You order first, try your drink and let them know if it's perfect for you, then pay. Generally, I try not to make them remake my drink more than twice cause you know, don't be wasteful. 

So if you ever find yourself in need of a study cafe, Philz is a great option.
author: Derek T.

description: This was my first time here and my barista Ivana was super helpful!! She guided me through the whole process with warmth and even remade my drink when I forgot to tell her it was iced. She's wonderful and a real representative of the kindness and values that Philz offers! I'll def be back soon.
author: Calvin H.

description:
Philz was so smart to open up this location - right across the street from City College, at the base of a brand new apartment building, and very close to a huge MUNI and BART hub. They have plenty of indoor AND outdoor seating - great place for students, WFH-ers and just passer-bys looking for a pick-me-up. 

If you haven't been to Philz before, here's the drill: Walk in, order at the bar with an available barista, walk over to the register to order food/pastries and pay for your drink while you wait for your drink to be ready. My usual go to is the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee (basic... I know, but it's so good) my other go to would be a Mocha Tesora which is great. I love that they've opened up this new location on Ocean Ave.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Little bit confusing to order for first timers but great coffee!

This location is super close to my friend's apartment and about a 5min walk to the BART station so it's super convenient if you want to just grab coffee on the go!

The shop is spacious with plenty of seating inside and outside and it even has a shared bookshelf if you just want a new read.

I got extremely confused as to how to order but I figured it out after watching others. Wish it did have instructions or a "Order here" sign that way it'd be more clear but it works. You don't have to wait too overly long for the coffee as there's multiple baristas.
author: Michelle N.

description:
It isn't often that Philz Coffee and the words Mint Mojito don't come up in the same sentence together. With that being said, one might be tempted to think that Philz is a one-trick pony. Not so! 

Each delicious cup at Philz is made fresh to order. For coffee aficionados, they have enough variety to keep you trying something new for a couple weeks. And for those looking for a new study spot, this Philz has a lovely college vibe which I find conducive to getting a lot of work done. It also doesn't hurt that the Wi-Fi is very reliable (ahem, Starbucks). The only issue may be getting a seat during peak hours, around midday.
author: Anderson H.

description:
My favorite Philz in the Bay! Way more chill and has it's decent wave of people throughout the day. It's not as loud here compared to Westborough and has way more comfortable seating and outlets compared to San Mateo and Burlingame. 

More kudos cause they picked a spot next to CCSF - much needed for those early morning classes and you need caffeine that actually works to jumpstart your day!
author: Erika D.

description: Really nice coffee shop to try when you came in town, I tried the famous mint mojito. I am a true Starbucks fan, but this is way better
author: john c.

description: First time trying Philz Coffee and I have been missing out big time! Their infamous mojito mint iced coffee was bomb.com! Such a wide open space.. plenty of seatings :)
author: Yennie L.

description:
This is undoubtedly my favorite and most convenient coffee spot around my neighborhood and I'm totally obsessed with how amazing I get treated every time I'm there (which is often) regardless if there's a line or not. I always get a Philtered Soul and an avocado toast to start off my day and get ready to make the best of it because I get a little boost of happiness. Philz coffee in general is the best coffee place hands down! 

One time, I accidentally dropped my large coffee all over the street so I came right back to Philz and I explained one employee (Janelle)what happened and though she was busy making other drinks, she was kind enough to make me another one ! It totally made my day and their free WiFi is like adding frosting to the cake 


I'll be definitely coming back here and any other Philz coffee spots around the city
author: Vanessa M.

description:
I only ever order the iced mint mojito at Philz (yes, I'm very adventurous, I know). Comparing apples to apples, this location lacks a certain something with their mint mojito. Maybe asking for extra sweet and creamy during my next visit will help. Otherwise, the drink tastes pretty watered down, even if it is lightly iced.

Staff is great and there is ample seating space. Parking is quite the nightmare around the area though. This is the closest Philz location to my house, so I'll definitely be back. Just need to learn how to customize their mint mojito to my liking!
author: Kristi T.

description: Cool ass crew. Quality service. Alyssa is a baddie! Always a smile on everyone's face!
author: Kristoff F.

description: Very fast service! Lots of study space if needed! Very spacious! Wait is short. I love the space but difficult to find a plug in!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
I want to say all the beautiful things about Philz, and their mint mojito is impressive. 9 times out of 10, my experience with the taste of their coffee is beyond what words can describe. But this Friday, which is today, I went in at around 5:00 p.m, which I am assuming was their slow time. I mean, the coffee was pretty good, and I ordered my usual. The only thing was while I was waiting to use their restroom, the seat outside of their bathroom had this puddle of water. The guy before me left the restroom with a funky smell. 

I have nothing against their coffees, but the atmosphere of this location grossed me out.
author: Renee L.

description:
I've been to many philz but I have to say this is by far the best one. The vibe and music to this place is just me. The HVAC is exposed which I think is very cool and adds an aesthetic to the place. The employees are full of energy and brightened up my day. The place is very spacious and there is ample seating and outlets for charging your gadgets. The menu is very nice too and evenly spaced out making is easier to read and pick out what you want faster. Perfect location since it's near CCSF. I will be coming back. Great Job Philz on Ocean. 

Customer Service A1
Drinks A1
Aesthetics A1
author: Brian C.

description:
This Philz location was a very smart move for the company, as it's one of the closest coffee shops/cafes for CCSF students to hang out and study at. The location is great as it's in the hub of many Muni bus lines, right underneath a bunch of apartments, close to Whole Foods and other restaurants nearby. They even have plenty of indoor AND outdoor seating! Great for just meeting up with people or if you have to do some work in between classes (that's me!)

As some may know, the flow of Philz is that you order at the bar first before heading to the register to order food and other things. My go-to is the iced philtered soul with vanilla soy and light plus sweet! **Tip- bring your own personal mug and only get charged the size of a small (12oz)! Makes each and every visit so worth it. 

The staff here is very friendly. I also love the music they play here which is a lot of hip-hop & R&B. I don't feel the need to plug my ears with other stuff, it's awesome!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
So happy this Philz opened up in the area! It's relatively close to BART and City College. A great spot to work remotely during the weekdays. 

You can order ahead using Caviar and our drinks were ready for us within the estimated time. 

Parking is a challenge, so I suggest you buddy up and have someone wait in the car in the lot beside the apartment while you go in to order your drinks. Or you can just chance it (not recommended).
author: Heather N.

description:
Popped my Philz coffee cherry and I couldn't have had a better experience! 

AMBIENCE (5 stars)
Upon walking in here, it was super spacious with plenty of seating, perfect for studying or playing games. There isn't a crazy amount of noise since they use drip coffees and the place has a nice hipstery feel. The staff was all super nice and explained how you order the coffee first, wait for it to be made, then pay after. 

COFFEE
They have maaaannnyyy different types of coffees with the whole range of roasts available. I wanted to try the infamous mint mojito, however that's better iced and has two spoons of sugar in it as well as cream. Since I'm lenting sugar, that wasn't an option ideal for me. The lady asked if I preferred light, medium, or dark roasts and after telling her I prefer darks, she reccommended the Jacobs to me. It was splendid with cream and very light sugar! Such rich chocolatey undertones with a wonderful coffee taste, that wasn't burnt. If I wasn't satisfied, she said I could come back for a different flavor too :)...

I'll definitely be coming back here in the near future to study or to jsut grab a coffee to sip on. Can't wait for Philz to come to Sacramento!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I love this Philz coffee.  I shop at the Whole Foods next door at least once a week and make sure to stop by Philz when I'm done with shopping.  I usually place an order for a iced mint mojito and Philz iced tea.  Both are delicious and seriously some of the best drinks I've had.  Service here is always top notch and the ladies who help me are incredibly friendly.  

This location is a pretty relaxing place to hang out or study.  Get the mint mojito if it's your first time!  It's one of my faves and if you're not much of a coffee drinker, try their iced teas!  They're delicious as well.  Love this place and can't wait for my next visit.
author: Christine P.

description:
Raina was super sweet my girl and I called ahead of time to see if our wallet on apple phones would work, to purchase the drinks we wanted. She told us to come in and try it, it didn't work therefore she'd honor it on the house. We came in, ordered and tried to proceed with the payment but there were complications. Raina was sweet enough to keep her word and give us coffee. 

Sorry if I spelled your name wrong, super sweet gal! Made our Friday!!
author: Halimah A.

description:
Nice location next to CCSF. I love this place to get some work done. The staff is very friendly and the music is usually right on point, with the exception of some days (But, I get it, different taste, preferences, and even mood)

If you are new, or want to try something good, you should order the Philthered Soul coffee (sorry for misspelling), this one is legit and flavorful! Give it a try!
author: William H.

description:
UPDATE****
They now close at 7pm because there wasn't enough business in the evenings. Better get it by dinner time if you want it and don't plan on meeting a date there after work.

ENVIRONMENT 
This is a good location to study or relax. The only drawback is that it is usually packed in the evenings when CCSF is in session and on Sunday mornings. It's difficult to find a seat.

SERVICE
It's usually great in the afternoon, but even when there are no lines on weekday mornings the service is slower than downtown. If you're in a hurry to get to work or hop on the Bart, then you should take that into consideration.

QUALITY
I've never had a bad cup of coffee or tea here. I like Silken Splendor (black).

The tea is good, but they only sell it by the cup. 

TIPS
If you want it hot, then tell them "do not air-rate." When they pour the water from high up its not for show. They call it air-rate and it cools down the water. 

The ordering process is different at Philz. You order first, pay second, then wait for your order to be called by the person helping you. 

Bring your own person mug. I bring a 16oz hydroflask and ask them to fill it up. Philz will only share you for a small when you use a personal mug even if it's oversized.
author: Eric E.

description:
This was my first time at Philz myself (normally my sister gets it for me although it's rare). You order at where you enter and up and then pay to the right. This wasn't clear to me until I asked, so I wish they had signs that clearly said "order here" and "pay here." It just makes things easier. 

I got their iced chai with medium sweetness and it was so refreshing and goooood. Love the sprig of mint for garnish too. The decor here is great--Halloween is clearly around the corner! Love it! 

Do note, it's superrrrrrrr crowded here! There are many tables here, but it was so busy that I had to sit outside. Yay for booming business but bummer for someone who gets cold easily (me)!
author: Angie Y.

description:
Mojito mint iced coffee is a MUST!!!

I'm not usually a coffee drinker, but fell in love with this picker upper.  It's an easy drink (almost too easy), so beware if you're not used to caffeine regularly.

I really wish we had something similar to this in Seattle...that's saying alot, being that Seattle is known for coffee...
author: Michelle F.

description: I have been going to this Philz since they've opened and it's still my favorite location for many reasons. I always order the Ice Jacobs (sweet and creamy) with extra ice. It's Smokey and chocolatey and I've recommended it to plenty of my friends who have also switched to getting Jacob and ended up being their favorite ! However, not everyone can make the drink the same. That was something that I've noticed throughout my many visits. I've probably had at least every barista make the drink for me and it differs so sometimes I'll have to adjust the order to them (sweetness lvl + ice). Something that I've noticed in a bunch of the newer workers is that when I ask for it to be sweet, it won't be sweet at all but all the sweetness would be at the very end of my drink because of the sugar that wasn't melted all the way. However, there have been many improvements and now every time I go, my coffee tastes strong and super delicious to my liking. And every barista there is super friendly!
author: Mandy C.

description: I love coming to philz everyday before going to class and everybody seems to be so enthusiastic and seems like they love what they are doing but when I came recently this one barista took my order and I told her I wanted this drink cold and payed for the drink and waited. When my drink was called it was hot and I told her I wanted it cold and she told me to be specific next time but I was specific tho.
author: Sharina G.

description:
At Philz I have only had their ice-tea with a little honey and mint leaves. I found to be refreshing and delicious. I am not a coffee drinker so I can comment on their coffee. Although, it smelled really good when I walk into the shop and I can smell them roasting the coffee. Service is friendly and the place is full of people working on their laptops and enjoying their morning cup of Philz coffee. The mint leave thing is a nice touch and I appreciate it.

My husband has their coffee and he found it to be good but nothing special. However, from my experience I would order their ice-tea every time I visit their shop.
author: Jaci Y.

description:
I got excited a few months back passing this Philz location when it was still under construction. FINALLY a Philz that's just one mile away from my home. 

Iupon entering, I noticed how spacious the store is. Plenty of room to sit and lounge. All the other sf locations I've been to have been a tiny store front so it was refreshing to see a change. Parking wasn't hard to find either which was surprising. At 8am on a Tuesday, you'd think "morning rush" but nooope no line at all. Despite being the first in line, no barista greeted me hello. Not very friendly when I made small talk. 

The good:
Spacious 
Very clean 
Location is close to home 

The bad: 
Dinged one star for not very friendly baristas


I would come to this location again. I wish the baristas were more personable. 
 
If you're tired of drinking iced mint mojito, try the tesora extra sweet extra creamy! You won't be disappointed
author: AJ C.

description:
I love this place!

I was introduced to Philz pretty recently and I've loved everything I've gotten here. I love how it's full service so someone (usually an awesome barista) is making my coffee to order, perfectly. They're also generally pretty knowledgeable about the blends and can provide recommendations.

This place has plenty of seating and an interesting round table. Though it'll get crowded, there are plugs everywhere which makes it a not bad place to work. Love their selection of board games too, for those chill weekends. Definitely recommended!
author: Robin Y.

description: This review is about the phone order for a large to-go box. I had to called several time to confirm my order and when I arrived in the morning to pick, the staff in the store had no record and no ideas what my order was and about. I ordered in advance so that you would have time to pour 8 cups of coffee in a large container. Instead, the staff asked me to wait for another 15 mins or so. So what's the point of me ordering in advance? Terrible and inconsistent service
author: Yc C.

description: Great atmosphere, great servers, amazing coffee! Highly recommended! Good place to study, quiet and enough movement to keep you from falling asleep
author: Nick A.

description:
Today was a warmer than usual day in SF so I decided to grab some Mint Mojito at this Philz to cool off. I asked if I could get my coffee medium plus in sweetness and creaminess, however when I got my coffee, it was really watery and bitter with no taste of mint whatsoever. I then asked if I could just get the sweetness and creaminess adjusted, the barista gave me a look and seemed displeased that he has to adjust the taste that I asked for. He just threw some sugar and cream together and gave it back to me in less than 10 seconds and didn't say a word. 

To my experience, I've tried Philz from a ton of locations in the Bay Area and this location is definitely under par for their iced coffee. In particular, their Ecstatic and Mint Mojito is watery and not served very cold compared to other Philz. The coffee that I ordered today straight up tasted like a black coffee with cold water. You are charging an extra dollar for the Mint Mojito, at least have some minty flavor in the drink. To be frank, I would definitely stay away from these two drinks if you were to visit this location. 

In conclusion, the customer service at this location is usually really good, but the barista today was disappointing. The Mint Mojito that I ordered was extremely bad, I did not even bother drinking it at home. 

Would I come back? 
Not until they improve their iced coffees. 

Service: 2/10 (today), usually 8/10 
Coffee: 1/10
Presentation: 4/10 (today), usually 10/10
Ambiance: 9/10
author: Zenas L.

description: If you need high octane to start your day, then Philz is a must go to spot! Their reputation, and quality coffee, along with service speaks for itself!
author: Dezi S.

description: Very convenient location. Getting a large size of mint mojito ice coffee is refreshing my day.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I ALWAYS love Philz. Never had a bad experience, however I've only gone to the one in Westborough. I give this Philz specifically 2 stars because of what happened to me today. To begin, a customer let me go ahead of her since she was still deciding. The dude who helped me called me over telling me he can help me. It was the most awkward barista experience I've had ever. No greeting when I came up to him. I used to be a barista not to long ago, so I said hello and gave my order. He repeated my order and continued to do his thing. After paying for my drink, I realized I forgot to ask for it iced. So I went back and told him how sorry I was and that I meant to ask for it iced. He repeated back saying, "iced?!" And rolled his eyes. Sheesh. My bad dude. Idk who ruined your day, but the least you could have done was tell me it was okay and that you could fix it for me. Also, I asked for my drink super sweet and it tasted barely sweet. Yeah, I should've told him to fix it but he already seemed annoyed. 

To the guy who helped me:
Thanks for the coffee. Hopefully you will treat customers better. I suggest you greet people and not have so much attitude. Whatever happened in your day should not affect your work since it definitely can affect the person you are serving.
author: Kimberly D.

description: This Philz is a great location, their building is huge, nicely decorated and clean. I came here around lunch time on the week day and there were plenty of people around just working or having a meeting. It's a great atmosphere to get some work done.  I had ordered the mint mojito and it still never disappoints.
author: Sherry L.

description: Nice location. I don't like visiting place where a lot of people. I prefer spend my free time in silence, read a book after SFCC or have a good conversation with my friends ))). Friendly stuff. They can advise you a good coffee. I definitely visit this place again.
author: Vicki G.

description: Frankly, I don't feel like Philz tea is anything too special to me. Perhaps because I'm not a coffee person I'm missing out. Had the Herbal Mint Tea and really liked the touch of having leaves in the drink.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Let me just say. I live in nyc I flew all the way to sf just for this coffee. That's how much I love their coffee. Always get the mint mojito and the avocado toast with eggs. even writing this review makes me want to go back right now. I was staying in Airbnb and the host told me to try it out. I'm so happy I found this place. This is my heaven. The people working there are super nice. I will always come back here. I miss everyone there !! See you soon.
author: Johnson W.

description:
As expected, great coffee and delicious food. Service is excellent--polite, fast, and my order is always correct. Lots of variety in the food menu.

Only critique is that the employees love when customers bring dogs of any type inside, and they pet the dogs (I've seen them wash their hands before going back behind the counter). I've also seen dogs sitting on the couches also. Anyways, if you have pet allergies stay away. 

Apart from that, a great neighborhood spot for coffee and food.
author: Sheila G.

description: Come for the coffee. Stay for the coffee. Leave with some coffee!  As an English Teacher at CCSF, I have come to rely on Philz for a great cup of dark roast (my trip into the ether) in order to maintain my needed alertness in the classroom. Jessy, the manager, is a great guy.  Always a pleasure to stop in ...
author: Nathan W.

description:
Today I stopped by Philz for a quick pick-me-up after yesternight's happy hour shenanigans. This coffee was extra extraordinary that it guided me back into writing Yelp reviews after taking a hiatus. 

Tesora straight up. No cream, no sugar, no ice, just us. When you buy it, it buys your trust. When you taste it, it tastes you back. When you hold it, it holds your heart. When you look at it, it looks into your soul. It's a coffee that caresses you every so gently that it's almost inappropriate. Every sip made my body jittery in a sensual quiver type of way, comparable to the feeling one gets after watching Twilight. The warm liquid gushes within your body cuddling your innermost feelings. If this coffee were a person, I'd treat her to a nice steak dinner and call her back. I now know what Miguel was talking about in his song "Coffee". It wasn't about sex, it was about the love making that occurs in your mouth after that first stimulating sip. 

Try Philz Coffee, it's lightweight cheap.
author: Andrew C.

description: As much as I want to dislike it,Philz mint mojito iced coffee is good. Not $5.50 good for a large,but good. I would definitely come back only on occasion as $5.50 for a large is pricey. I got so confused at first going in for the ordering. It turns out you order first and then pay once you get your drink.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Coffee here is wonderful!!
Had a problem with my coffee once. Emailed the company and got an email back within 1 hour.
Everything was worked out and the manager of this store was really kind!!
Would come back here for sure!!
Philz really do care about their customers!!
author: Lydia B.

description: The only thing I order here is an extra creamy mint mojito, and it is perfect. Creamy and sweet, with light touches of coffee to it, not to heavy or light. The store is a great place to get work done, plenty of table space and outlets most of the time. It's warm, smells nice, and not too noisy.
author: Donald C.

description:
I've placed my order here twice through the Order Ahead app and got exactly what I asked for both times. The app basically allows you to customize your drink just as you would in person, choose a pick-up time at least 10 minutes out, prepay, and pick it up at the counter with all the other online orders; I was in and out in less than 20 seconds, if that. Download it and skip the inevitable weekday morning lines!

The girls who work here are super sweet, the quality of the drinks is the same as all other Philz (Philzs? Philzes???), and the location is a somewhat unexpected but welcome one!
author: Olivia V.

description: Extremely slow... you'd better tell the one who's making the coffee what you want to order first and then go to the register. They blamed me for not knowing this! I ended up leaving to catch the bus without getting my coffee.
author: Yuanyuan F.

description: I love the people here.  However, your toaster burns everything to the point where it's black.  And you have the audacity to serve it like it's Ok.  This happens to me every single time.  No one likes bagels burn to pure black!
author: Krissy L.

description: When I found out this place opened up near my boyfriend's house, I had to come. I usually order the Mint Mojito and pick out the mint. My boyfriend introduced me to the Ecstatic Iced Coffee which is the Mint Mojito without the mint. I loved it! Cool baristas and delicious drinks! You order your drink at the bar and then pay for it at the register. They even have a separate bar for to-go orders. There is ample seating here for you to hang out with your friends, if you need to study, or if you just want to play board games. The crowd is very diverse and hipster. Definitely coming back!
author: Amy T.

description: I stopped here on my way home, I was so excited that they finally opened near city college!! The people who work here are friendly and easy to talk to. The store is nice and somewhat big, has outdoor seating on ocean Ave and is right where the 29 and the k lines stop on ocean Ave and Lee. I love Philz coffee it's a treat for me because it's not near my house, this location and the van ness Ave are the closest to my house.
author: Alix J.

description:
The Iced Mint Mojito!
A must have! Even you are not that into Coffee(like myself) I am sure you will fall in love with Philz after you try their coffee...
Pros: 
-baristas are super efficient 
-nice environment(chairs/games/chargers for ur laptop)
-good coffee
Con:
-Music is too loud
author: Emily H.

description:
Coffee is awesome here! The inside is big and I come here often during my lunch time with my colleagues to have a sip of coffee and just relax for a bit during my lunch. It's a cool place to hangout with your friends and to just catch up on things for a moment in life. Oh, don't forget about the coffee. Or else it would be weird just being here without a drink. 

Overall, coffee and friends are my best matches for this place.
author: Brenda C.

description:
"Sweamy, please!"
This is what I say every time I order a mint mojito from Philz (sweet + creamy for those that haven't caught on yet).
Location is spot on during the school year - right by City college and Whole Foods on Ocean Ave.
Parking can be fairly difficult (but honestly, when isn't it in SF?)
I don't drink coffee much, but I absolutely love their mint mojitos and hot chocolates. A bit pricey, but definitely worth it.
author: Attiana P.

description:
This is the best cup of coffee I have had in a very long time!! Fuck Starbucks. This place SLAYS on Starbucks!! 

My drink: 
I got a light roast coffee ("New Manhattan" which is BOMB) with light cream (they steamed it) and one sweetnlow and omgggggggg it's heaven in your mouth!! Since it's a full service coffee shop, they make your drink from start to finish (no condiment bar). Usually with Starbucks coffee, I have to do so much extra stuff just to make it palatable but not this place!!! Omg it's divine!! And I don't say that lightly being that I am a former 4 year barista myself. 

My food: 
I also got an Avacado toast too. It comes with zaatar, salt, pepper and olive oil but I substituted the oil for honey and it's comes on sour dough bread for $4.50. 

The place: 
Inside, its modern, earthy, and spacious with an industrial design touch. They have a beautiful patio and large in door seating area!! Since it's newly open, it was packed inside! And thats at 4:30pm on a Sunday! But there was still plenty of seating on the patio! It's conveniently located next to Whole Foods, McDonald's, and other local eateries. 

Customer service: 
Everyone was so nice and so helpful!! I was kind of taken back a bit with how genuine everyone was. It was refreshing to see one of kind service restored once again! I will definitely be making this my new go-to spot!
author: Stephanie A.

description: Great location near city college, Whole Foods ..... finally some higher grade coffee on this side of SF. It's tricky to get parking sometimes but it's great if your riding the bus. It's really big inside with room to meet or chill.  Staff here is super friendly, has the student vibe.... only draw back I've noticed at this location, is that there always seem to be some creeper type fools here tho lurking around glaring at the college age kids like 'the best thing about college kids is the older I get they stay the same age' pffff who's dads are kicking it here?
author: John O.

description: Dope spot. Perfect place to study as a ccsf student. Nice neighborhood vibe as well. I appreciate how they're open super early which allows me to get some studying in before class. Not usually a big line when I go but even if so, they have the order ahead option.
author: Carlo R.

description: I used the Try Caviar app to order ahead. I sent my drink to the wrong location so they made me my drink on the house. 6/5 stars.
author: David R.

description:
Good service, locations and coffee!
Apparently they can do half blend of coffee if you request them to do so, so today I got half Silken Splendor and Philtered Soul. Medium cream and medium sugar. It's super good.
author: Gabriella S.

description: Coffee mint mojito is a strange concept that works so well! Not only is the drink great , the service is lovely. It's good to see happy employees!
author: Em L.

description:
Great joint to hit up when you on Ocean Ave. haha
They have a lot of seating and it is a great place to study because they have outlets almost at every table. 

The coffee there is really good such as the iced mint mojito because they use fresh mint and it gives it a fresh touch at the end after drinking the coffee.
author: Brittany L.

description: Baristas are always sure to make your order exactly how you want it, all the staff is super friendly and accommodating, the space is really nice with a ton of seating and the coffee shop itself is in a really convenient location. Best Philz in the city!
author: Robyn M.

description: I love this philz because it is so close to school and the workers are always so fun and happy whenever I come in. I'm not super big on coffee, so I ruin it with cream and sugar (extra cream and extra sugar at that). I always come in for an ecstatic extra sweet extra creamy and they always get it just how I like it. This location is a great place to study because they have plenty of room for lounging and they have some games if you want to just hang out with friends too. Definitely coming back for as long as I'm in school in SF.
author: Tram H.

description: This location rocks. It is about time this Area gets a better cafe than the ones in the area. This Philz Coffee rocks. It is just as great as the other Philz Coffee locations. I bet the cafes in the area and the one at CCSF and the one right across the street from CCSF will loose some business. I don't think the Starbucks at Target on Ocean Ave will not loose business. I love Philz Coffee a lot. Philz Coffee rocks.
author: Isaac H.

description:
Perfect place for students to study, do h.w, socialize, or just get stuff done. The area is so nice, the staff are super duper friendly and quirky, and there are outlets everywhere, even on the tables! 
I like the system they have when you order your drinks. You wait in line, they call you up to say what you want, and then you move down and pay. 
Philz is pricey compared to other java drinks, however, they provide their drinks well made and rich in flavor.
Im not quite a huge coffee person so when i ordered the Mint Mojito extra sweet, it was still more on the pure strong dark coffee sided taste and I barely tasted the sweetness. However, it was still decent..therefore, i guess i could say coffee lovers that love strong coffee should definitely hit this place up.
I still have yet to try more of their drinks and food.
author: Stacey M.

description: The girls here never make my coffee correctly (blonde and brunette with long hair recently dyed). So I end up always going to the guys. If I say medium cream they literally make it so creamy. What's the point of asking me how much cream if you mess it up or ask me multiple times?  Additionally, they are so unprofessional for a $4.50 coffee. No excuse me, please, thank you, or you're welcome. Also, if you plan to talk badly about other customers please try not to do it in front of another customer. This is a customer service job. You need understand what that entails. I watched the blonde (recently dyed brunette) barista sneeze into her hand then continue to make coffee. Disgusting.
author: Alex P.

description: This place is fabulous! It can get really busy, and the wait for your drink might take a bit longer then expected but Im glad that theres effort in making my drink. I would recommend the mint mojito drink, I always get regular on the sweetness, it seems my drink always comes out perfect. The only con is that sometimes theres to much greenery (mint) in my drink and it blocks the spout when drinking.
author: Cassandra G.

description: Philz coffee is the real coffee you must drink . My favorite is mint mojito ice coffee . If you know has any better taste than mint mojito please share with me .
author: Tang C.

description: I love this spot! The people who work here are really laid back and extremely nice. The downside is that it's very packed at some points. Having said that, if weather permits, the outside seating is perfect. Definitely a welcoming spot. Oh and it helps that they actually understand the art of coffee!
author: Tyler D.

description: What can I say made to order coffee with a hipster flair! I do wish they would bring back the old style of ether, the new one does not embody the name!
author: Paul D.

description: Well this review will be short but get straight to the point. Went to Philz this morning because I wanted to get a quick bite to eat. Got their seasonal fruit danish which was listed at 3.50. When I got my change back I realized that I was taxed on FOOD. Most coffee places in San Francisco don't charge tax, not even the even empire of Starbucks charges tax for their food. This is just a reason why Philz is the new evil empire of coffee. I stopped getting coffee at any Philz over 3 years ago because they raised their prices because supposedly workers started getting health coverage and wages increased although the quality of their coffee at all their locations I use to frequent has dramatically gone down while prices continue to rise for their items. This tax on food at the ocean Ave location was just the final slap in the face. I will never ever spent money at Philz again and continue to tell everyone I know to avoid them at all costs.
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
This is a review for philz in general. I've only been to 2 locations but my experience was very much the same. This is where I had my first Philz and I must say I felt a bit overwhelmed because all their coffees have special names and it's hard to choose! However, Their coffee experts are very knowledgeable and willing to help you find your perfect cup!

I got the Jacobs wonderbar as the barista recommendation and she got it 100% right.  Best coffee I've had in the US! I loved the flavor ~ with hints of dark chocolate, smoke, and nuts (not smoke from cigars, the meaty smoke I'd assume, but actually didn't taste it so much). All I said was that I liked Lattes that were creamy~ I've also tried the tesora  (with caramel nuts and butter hints) but still prefer Jacobs and continue to order this one.

They have some real special coffees but I'm conservative so will probably stick to my own, if you want something different, how about trying the mint bonito iced coffee? Looks very Pretty!
author: Mimi Y.

description:
Yay!!! A Philz Coffee in Ocean Ave near CCSF!! I think thats awesome! The other locations they had had kinda crappy parking. I usually get lucky finding parking in this area on the times I've come in. 

My faves: Soo Good and Iced Mint Mojito --- I think they are pretty much the same but one is just hot and other cold.. lol!!
author: Carmina D.

description:
Service is great !
The employees do give a warm welcome.
The food is quality !
THE NOISE is TOO MUCH. It is rather stressful in the morning when you are waking up and all you want to do is to drink coffee and enjoy the beginning of the day.  In order to have a conversation one feels as if one must scream.
author: Francisco R.

description: Their coffee is as good as it gets..their prices however, are not. In all seriousness, I think Philz has the best coffee in US by a long shot. I have not found the same deep chocolate notes or richness at any other coffee shop. To get a sense of this, just try Jacob's Wonderbar or Julia's Ultimate. Their mint mojito iced coffees is also off the charts. Can't believe I didn't find out about Philz sooner, (was a Peet's drinker for 10 years), although my wallet definitely thanks me.
author: Daniel F.

description: I am from Los Angeles, and we do not have a Philz down there nearly as big as this one. There was plenty of space and awesome baristas. BUT I am writing this review because this coffee shop seriously has the BEST playlist I've ever heard in a coffee shop, throwback R&B from the 90's to 00's. So dope! Definitely good study music, and when I come back to SF I am def coming back here to study.
author: Erick P.

description:
`Philz Coffee hasn't been a destination for months, or is it years? was an uber fan upon first taste years ago. now, not so much. just a curiosity.

drill: line up, wait for call by barrista, u order drink, u go paid at cashiers down the line, get eats if needed. come back to pick up drink when drink is called. curious why the tip jar is at farthest corner from the barristas?

brew: julie's ultimate(lg 4.5)
aromas: "nuts, oatmeal, cinnamon" tasted herby to me.
-made by barristas in front of u, no back table, "live".
-some barristas make it "performance pouring" ala a coffee fall

drips:
-coffee chains (starbux, peets too) relabel coffee in company's ala designer coffee
ala teavana for tea
-indys sell coffee touting countries of origin, i,e, ethiopian, honduras, etc.
prefer this method more, not a fan of blends from the chains...
-associates very animated, personable. 4.5 stars for them...
-philz coffee usually has no private parking ala other chains...
-pricey too.
author: Victor G.

description: I really like the people here and I love Philz coffee but their consistency at this location is horrible. One barista will make my coffee great while another is just terrible. This also goes for food as well. On more than one occasion I've either received my breakfast sandwich frozen in the middle or my breakfast burrito burned to a crisp. I know they get busy and the staff is really great but get your stuff together!
author: Victor G.

description:
Favorite coffee place by far. 

Atmosphere-amazing
     Weekends can get pretty packed- so beware! However the drinks come out fairly quickly. 

Baristas- super friendly, and they KNOW how to make your drinks to perfection 

If you come here, make sure to look for Rachael . She's such a friendly, easy to talk to person who kicks ass in making drinks. I ordered the chai latte and mocha tesora and she asked if she could change it up a bit. IF SHE ASKS ALWAYS SAY YES BECAUSE HER DRINKS COME OUT 100000x BETTER. She's talented and knows her flavors. 

If you want coffee, come here, don't sip elsewhere
author: Esther K.

description:
Pros: great coffee, great service, reasonable price for what you pay for (3.50 for a small, 4.50 for a large and 18/lb of whichever coffee blend you choose)

Cons: 
the menu is overwhelming (over 20 blends of coffee to choose from), but the flavor profiles of each blend makes it easier if you know what you like

Suggestions: 
Ask one of the baristas on the side for a blend they suggest or try their coffee of the month tasting 
If you're not into coffee they've got interesting tea blends (I'm aiming for the chai next time) but they only sell that per cup (not loose leaf)
Get their early (I got there before 8 on a weekday and the line was short) or use the orderahead app
author: Emaline L.

description: I've always been a fan. Worked in the Castro and was a daily customer even when they moved locations. I've tried their Mojito, ambrosia and all sorts of blends but there is one, but only one holy grail that is the God in the coffee echelon, JACOBs WONDERBAR BREW. Dark, full bodies, rich and packs a punch. Philz is not for the weak hearted cause I've always said, their coffee is "heart palpitation" levels. If you want strong coffee, look no further. This new location in Ocean Ave is pretty much slower than the others. I.e. Castro, Market St or even by the Caltrain, maybe because it's new or also because it is pricier that starbucks. But money well worth spent. Trust me and give it a try... you won't regret it! 6/5 stars.
author: Jan R.

description: The people here are the best. They always greet you with a smile. They take the time to remember your name. They remember how you like your coffee. I can honestly say, these people help me get through some high stress days with their mad coffee skills and their positive attitude. I hope my new schedule will permit me to keep coming here on my works days. Great job guys.
author: Sheldon W.

description: I LOVE Philz and I was so excited to see one open near my house on ocean ave. This Philz is always full of studying students which I love. Reminds me of my days in undergrad. There is never a long line and the baristas are pretty fast. I have to take away a star because the mint mojito isn't always consistent. Sometimes it's perfect and other times it's a bit watery. Overall, service is excellent!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Yum, finally a Philz in the area by CCSF. It's nice to have a choice between Philz and the Lion Cafe! I swear they just start making up new names/neighborhoods in SF...since when was there a "westwood park" lol..super hipster. 

I come here to study--sat at the big round table and it was actually silent! What I did notice is that they turn their music up WAY too LOUD. I had to use earphones to silence some of the noise.
author: Alice Z.

description: It is good place to study. There are a lot of sockets. The only problem is pretty loud music. But if you have a earphone, it should be okay!. It was clean and good place.
author: J K.

description: Three times I've ordered a SESAME seed bagel and gotten something else...I'm mildly allergic to the everything bagel that they gave me so I had to throw it away...please listen to your customers!
author: Mariam A.

description: This has quickly become my favorite PHILZ COFFEE shop, because of their AWESOME coffee coupled with their superstar TEAM!  (Although I meet great staff at ALL the Philz shops!) The staff who work here are so nice and friendly!  The coffee is slightly more expensive than comparable coffee houses BUT the quality is FAR higher. LOVE PHILZ!!!
author: Victor T.

description:
This is a great addition to the ever changing SF. I know, I know, gentrification. But I like options and not having to run across town.

Customer service is ok. I still get sort've confused with the whole set up, but they are nice at assisting you if you look a little unsure.

The barista made my boyfriends drink a little meh, mine turned out great though! I usually opt for the mocha tesora or mint mojito. Cant go wrong there!
author: Sweets N.

description:
Love this location. I ordered a mint mojito and it was the most delicious cup of coffee ever! Definitely not on the same level as Starbucks or Peet's. 

They have a lot of space for people to do homework and lounge around which is nice. The location is good for CCSF and SFSU students!
author: Sherise D.

description: It was a fun place . My first visit . College students hang out place . Professional servers although my mocha was hardly warm .
author: Amir H.

description: Amazing welcoming always. They always make my coffee spot on even when I ask it a certain way. Their bagels are bomb too omg. It's my go to spot now. Worth the walk lol
author: Dora A.

description:
I usually go to the Philz Coffee in SOMA and at the headquarters, but wanted to try this new location out. This Philz is located on Ocean Ave, near CCSF and Whole Foods. Moderate amount of street parking, residential parking nearby has a 2 hr limit. They have 6-8 tables that seat 2 people, and 1 big table that can seat 8-10 people. They also have lots of little tables on the outside deck. 

Like the other Philz, you place your order before paying. You then pick up your drinks from the barista you ordered from. I tried the new Tesora medium blend and I thought it was a little too bitter. 

I gave 3 stars because the customer service was subpar. There wasn't a line when I went (but there usually is!), but the baristas and cashiers didn't greet us and weren't friendly. There were also a couple of customers who were new to Philz, and they paid first before ordering but nobody helped them so they were confused and waiting for their drinks for a long time. 

I would come back again if they improved their customer service.
author: Ruby K.

description: Philz is on Ocean! So excited to have this nice cafe in my neighborhood! Friendly barista! Nice environment! Good foods and coffees! Nice place for students to have a rest here! I will come more often absolutely!
author: Eva F.

description:
Perfect for studying but I feel like they need more seats and outlets for charging? Maybe something like power extension will help?

The restroom was not working when I was there which was a bummer.. cause I need to walk all the way to Whole Foods. 

I ordered the Tesora (almond milk and light on sugar) at another location before but somehow the taste for this location seems a bit off. Not sure why? But I preferred the Tesora at the other philz :(
author: Katrina C.

description: Ordered ahead, and had to wait over 10 mins after arrival. Would have been faster to order when I got there, since there was no line and they were serving customers who had arrived after me. Guess I won't be doing that again.
author: James C.

description: Free pastry for the excited line out the door! Beautiful, spacious outdoor seating. Free coffee on opening day. So excited to finally have Philz in the neighborhood!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Nice shop, lots of seats and warm. Going to have my favorite estatic and mojito coffees
author: Jane D.

description: I love Philz, I even love this Philz. But why do they keep it so freaking cold in there now?? The door is always open so it's freezing, and it's small enough that between the two entrances you really can't get far enough inside to be warm. I'm not a business owner, but it seems pretty obvious that if everyone is sitting with their coats on, maybe you should try to make it warmer. It's possible that they do that to stop people from sitting there indefinitely, but if that's what they're doing it doesn't appear to be working. I could be wrong. Other than that, great place.
author: Nelson D.

description: It's great coffee, but the lack of espresso is what loses a star from me. I love coffee, I love Philz, but I love espresso even more.
author: Raphael S.

description: Loved the service by the duo gals, energetic and helpful.  Coffee and tea selection is amazing.  Busy place with all the students from city college studying.
author: Nilu S.

description: Iced, large mint mojito is 5.50 out the door. Coffee is good, attitude not so good. Worth the hype and $5.50, nope. The shop itself is large and clean but so crowded with students you can't enjoy the expensive coffee you just paid for.
author: Dee Dee R.

description: Dope coffee, dope location, dope employees, dope seating, dope to have "OrderAhead" but tough to find parking! My goto spot for really awesome coffee!!!
author: Cee B.

description: Noticed that Ocean Ave has their own Philz Coffee when I first came home from SoCal. This location is where the old Phelan Loop was for the 8X and 49. The shop is huge with plenty of seating and tables available. Since this location is right next to CCSF, there are many students studying or hanging out in the shop. I ordered the Philharmonic which comes with mint leaves. The people working here are friendly and quick at brewing everyone's orders. What sets Philz Coffee apart is that they brew one cup at a time versus other coffee shops that brew by the batch which results in a lack of flavoring. The manager at this location was paying attention to detail, as she was advising one of the baristas on properly setting up the coffee filter. A good alternative to Starbucks and Fog Lifter on Ocean Ave. It's good to see more businesses investing on Ocean Ave, as there is always business from students. But in the most recent years the character of the neighborhood has changed for the good. Empty lots and storefronts are being occupied instead of being empty for years which is good. Good to see a longstanding small business expand across San Francisco and California. Will return more often, as there is no longer a need to go all the way to the Mission for a cup of Philz Coffee.
author: Peter C.

description: FYI This is the only place in the city where you can find Turkish and Arabica real coffees in one place. Try you won't be disappointed!
author: Firuz N.

description: Had a nice time studying here. Had ample room for 4 and WiFi was quick, also you can't go wrong with a mint mojito
author: Sean D.

description: My mom and I ordered a couple of Mocha Tesoras last night and it messed with our stomachs.
author: peter p.

description: Amaaazing coffee, great service, and a super clean and inviting atmosphere. I love it here. Philtered soul is my favorite so far! Thanks Philz on Ocean!
author: Steph L.

description: Philz is a Bay Area staple. I absolutely love how the baristas are set up. They definitely take the time to make sure you are buying a coffee that you will enjoy. My favorites include the Mint Mohito, Ambrosia (ask for med sweet with Nutmeg!), and the Silken Soul (a combo of the Silken Splendor and Philtered Soul). My girlfriend also loves getting their pastries and bagels for a quick breakfast. Whether you're a coffee expert or drinking coffee for the first time, this is the place to go. Don't be afraid to talk to the baristas, they absolutely can come up with something for you!
author: Donel L.

description: Good selection of Coffee to choose from, all made to order. Helpful friendly staff. Only drawback is much the same for most of SF......parking can be a challenge if you are not within walking distance.  Nice stop off on a cold evening!
author: Jon B.

description: I like Philz coffee. My only issue with this location is that the music is too loud.
author: Sachin P.

description: Ordering is a bit weird because you tell them what coffee you order first then you pay and iced mint mojito is okay hot chocolate sweet is the best
author: Queenie R.

description: Their coffee is great and this place has a perfect atmosphere. This place is one of my favorite coffee shops to study.
author: Amy L.

description: Stop by for a cup of joe, friendly service and sunny space. Bravo once again to Philz.
author: Heather R.

description: Rayna is always sweet as is my coffee just like I order. Great service all around from the beginning to end. I enjoy their their themed tip jars though I wish there was a way to tip with card because I don't always carry cash.
author: Alice S.
